events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed a claim for damages sustained in the accident on April 30th.
The claim has been categorised as an Auto Accident case, based on the keywords and accident description provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims has been assigned to handle the case and contact the customer for further information.
The insurance company has acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer that the investigation will begin shortly.
The agent requested the customer submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim.
The claimant has submitted all requested documents including detailed photos, a police report, and a mechanic’s repair estimate.
The investigation team has started reviewing submitted evidence and is coordinating with the repair shop and police for further verification.
The investigation concluded confirming the accident details provided by the customer were accurate and the damage assessment aligns with the claim.
A settlement offer covering the estimated repair costs has been prepared and sent to the claimant for review and acceptance.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the communication and handling of the claim.
Following the customer’s acceptance, the claim has been formally approved for payment and repairs can proceed without delay.
The reimbursement payment for vehicle repairs has been issued to the customer’s bank account as per the policy terms.
The claim file has been closed successfully after payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that repairs are completed.
The claim documentation and records have been archived in compliance with regulatory requirements for future reference if needed.
